alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Harnett; Johnston; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Harnett, southwestern Wake, west central Johnston and southeastern Chatham Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 507 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Cary to near Fuquay-Varina to 7 miles northeast of Angier to 7 miles southeast of Garner. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fuquay-Varina, Clayton, Angier, Apex, Holly Springs, Four Oaks, New Hill, Coats Crossroads, Harris Lake Boat Launch and Shearon Harris Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
